name: Owner
principles: Heavy work is only productive if clean; if bar speed slows, pivot to volume.
No grinding reps (RPE 10 is rarely the goal).
Deadlifts: Start every rep from the floor (dead stop).
Warmups: Longer warmups preferred for confidence.
Sick/Low Readiness: Immediately shift to volume work, do not force heavy weights.
physical_context: Knee: Doing indoor cycling (130bpm) + physio stabilization. Needs short stabilization work after cycling.
Shoulder: Considering Turkish Get-Ups (16kg) for stability.
nutrition_rules: Protein Powder: Scoop is 30g containing 22g protein (75% concentration).
I use olive oil for salads (assume 1 tbsp if not specified).
takeaways: Squat: Progressed from 80-82 volume to 100x4 heavy.
Bench: 90x2 was slow/grindy; needs backoff volume (80-82) to stabilize.
Deadlift: 110x5 was heavy (singles); goal is to make it a continuous set before moving up.
Bench: 80kg volume felt controlled with RPE 8, moving towards RPE 9 on later sets, suggesting good backoff volume for stabilization.
Deadlift volume at 100kg RPE 8 consistent across multiple sets.
